name: Rondo in D Major K. 485
description: Written by Mozart, I performed this Rondo at my final Formal Recital!

name: Liebesleid
description: I love this piece, and although I never perfected it in the way I would've liked to, I'm really proud of the parts that I did do!

name: Songs without Words
description: I performed this for our online formal recital.  Songs without Words is a collection of Mendelssohn pieces, and this is one of the around 50 pieces that are in this collection!

name: Doctor Gradus Ad Parnassum
description: Another one of Debussy's Children's Corner pieces, I love the understated melody of this piece - though the ending isn't my favorite.

name: All Of Me
description: One of my all time favorite pieces, this one has some fun quirks - like banging the piano with your entire arm!

name: Sonata in A-flat Major K. 127
description: I started learning this right at the beginning of the pandemic, when we were still very much locked down.  I was so thankful for piano during this time, and learned many pieces during this period.

name: Golliwogg's Cakewalk
description: This playful piece was easy to learn and fun to play!  It is one of Debussy's Children's Corner pieces.

name: Liebestraum
description: Liebestraum was an incredibly difficult piece.  The cadenzas and middle half of the piece were a slog to get through, but I'm glad I did!

name: Wedding Song at Troldhaugen
description: I was so excited when I found this piece on Youtube!  It's one that I come back to time after time, and still enjoy each time I play.

name: Sonata Pathetique
description: This is the first movement of Sonata Pathetique by Beethoven, learned during Sophomore year of High School.  I still love the challenge of this piece!

name: Nocturne Opus 7 No. 1
description: I departed from my normal baroque or classical music to play this piece, one of Chopin's most famous nocturnes.

name: Aufschwung
description: Even now, I seriously enjoy this piece.  It was a challenging one to learn, but I loved the dual drama and beauty!

name: Waterfall
description: Written by Jon Schmidt, Waterfall was an incredibly dramatic and fun piece to play!  Octave runs and funky accents made it a tricky one!

name: Bach Invention in C Major
description: IDK what to put here

name: Praeludium
description: This is a family classic, with my Great-Grandpa playing this to my Grandma. I loved the shifting melody and challenging arpeggios in the RH!

name: Scherzo in C Major
description: IDK

name: Bach Partita
description: This was one of the first long pieces that I learned which spanned multiple movements (Minuet 1, 2, and Gigue).

name: Heavenly Father Loves Me
description: A duet with my best friend Parker that we played in Church.

name: Dragonfly Scherzo
description: A very high energy piece that I played over 7 years ago!

name: Concerto
description: This was performed at my academy's Ensemble Recital with my classmates Parker, Grace, and Remi.

name: Sonatina in C by Clementi
description: I played the first two movements of this piece at one of our recitals.

name: Sakura
description: We all start from somewhere, and I started with Sakura.  I wish I had more videos from my earliest years of piano, but at least I have my first!
